verses.verse: And after <S%G3326><s%> the uproar <S%G2351><s%> had ceased, <S%G3973><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> sent <S%G3343><s%> for the disciples <S%G3101><s%> and when he had exhorted <S%G3870><s%> them and taken <S%G782><s%> his leave <S%G782><s%> of them, he departed <S%G1831><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> to Macedonia. <S%G3109><s%>

And when he had gone <S%G1330><s%> through <S%G1330><s%> those <S%G1565><s%> districts <S%G3313><s%> and had given <S%G3870><s%> them much <S%G4183><s%> exhortation, <S%G3870><s%> <S%G3056><s%> he came <S%G2064><s%> to Greece. <S%G1671><s%>

And [there] he spent <S%G4160><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> months, <S%G3376><s%> and when a plot <S%G1917><s%> was formed <S%G1096><s%> against <S%G1917><s%> him by the Jews <S%G2453><s%> as he was about <S%G3195><s%> to set <S%G321><s%> sail <S%G321><s%> for Syria, <S%G4947><s%> he determined <S%G1096><s%> <S%G1106><s%> to return <S%G5290><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> Macedonia. <S%G3109><s%>

And he was accompanied <S%G4902><s%> by Sopater <S%G4986><s%> of Berea, <S%G961><s%> [the son] of Pyrrhus; <S%G4450><s%> and by Aristarchus <S%G708><s%> and Secundus <S%G4580><s%> of the Thessalonians; <S%G2331><s%> and Gaius <S%G1050><s%> of Derbe, <S%G1190><s%> and Timothy; <S%G5095><s%> and Tychicus <S%G5190><s%> and Trophimus <S%G5161><s%> of Asia. <S%G774><s%>
But these <S%G3778><s%> had gone <S%G4281><s%> on ahead <S%G4281><s%> and were waiting <S%G3306><s%> for us at Troas. <S%G5174><s%>

And we sailed <S%G1602><s%> from Philippi <S%G5375><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> the days <S%G2250><s%> of Unleavened <S%G106><s%> Bread, and came <S%G2064><s%> to them at Troas <S%G5174><s%> within <S%G891><s%> five <S%G4002><s%> days; <S%G2250><s%> and there <S%G3699><s%> we stayed <S%G1304><s%> seven <S%G2033><s%> days. <S%G2250><s%>

And on the first <S%G1520><s%> day of the week, <S%G4521><s%> when we were gathered <S%G4863><s%> together <S%G4863><s%> to break <S%G2806><s%> bread, <S%G740><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> [began] talking <S%G1256><s%> to them, intending <S%G3195><s%> to depart <S%G1826><s%> the next <S%G1887><s%> day, <S%G1887><s%> and he prolonged <S%G3905><s%> his message <S%G3056><s%> until <S%G3360><s%> midnight. <S%G3317><s%>
And there were many <S%G2425><s%> lamps <S%G2985><s%> in the upper <S%G5253><s%> room <S%G5253><s%> where <S%G3757><s%> we were gathered <S%G4863><s%> together. <S%G4863><s%>

And there was a certain <S%G5100><s%> young <S%G3494><s%> man <S%G3494><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Eutychus <S%G2161><s%> sitting <S%G2516><s%> on the window <S%G2376><s%> sill, <S%G2376><s%> sinking <S%G2702><s%> into a deep <S%G901><s%> sleep; <S%G5258><s%> and as Paul <S%G3972><s%> kept on talking, <S%G1256><s%> he was overcome <S%G2702><s%> by sleep <S%G5258><s%> and fell <S%G4098><s%> down <S%G2736><s%> from the third <S%G5152><s%> floor, <S%G5152><s%> and was picked <S%G142><s%> up dead. <S%G3498><s%>

But Paul <S%G3972><s%> went <S%G2597><s%> down <S%G2597><s%> and fell <S%G1968><s%> upon him and after embracing <S%G4843><s%> him, he said, <S%G3004><s%> "Do not be troubled, <S%G2350><s%> for his life <S%G5590><s%> is in him."

And when he had gone <S%G305><s%> [back] up, and had broken <S%G2806><s%> the bread <S%G740><s%> and eaten, <S%G1089><s%> he talked <S%G3656><s%> with them a long <S%G2425><s%> while, <S%G2425><s%> until <S%G891><s%> daybreak, <S%G827><s%> and so <S%G3779><s%> departed. <S%G1831><s%>
And they took <S%G71><s%> away <S%G71><s%> the boy <S%G3816><s%> alive, <S%G2198><s%> and were greatly <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3357><s%> comforted. <S%G3870><s%>

But we, going <S%G4281><s%> ahead <S%G4281><s%> to the ship, <S%G4143><s%> set <S%G321><s%> sail <S%G321><s%> for Assos, <S%G789><s%> intending <S%G3195><s%> from there <S%G1564><s%> to take <S%G353><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> on board; <S%G353><s%> for thus <S%G3779><s%> he had arranged <S%G1299><s%> it, intending <S%G3195><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> to go <S%G3978><s%> by land. <S%G3978><s%>
And when <S%G5613><s%> he met <S%G4820><s%> us at Assos, <S%G789><s%> we took <S%G353><s%> him on board <S%G353><s%> and came <S%G2064><s%> to Mitylene. <S%G3412><s%>

And sailing <S%G636><s%> from there, <S%G2547><s%> we arrived <S%G2658><s%> the following <S%G7075><s%> day opposite <S%G481><s%> Chios; <S%G5508><s%> and the next <S%G2087><s%> day we crossed <S%G3846><s%> over <S%G3846><s%> to Samos; <S%G4544><s%> and the day following <S%G2192><s%> we came <S%G2064><s%> to Miletus. <S%G3399><s%>

For Paul <S%G3972><s%> had decided <S%G2919><s%> to sail <S%G3896><s%> past <S%G3896><s%> Ephesus <S%G2181><s%> in order <S%G3704><s%> that he might <S%G1096><s%> not have to spend <S%G5551><s%> time <S%G5551><s%> in Asia; <S%G773><s%> for he was hurrying <S%G4692><s%> to be in Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> possible, <S%G1415><s%> on the day <S%G2250><s%> of Pentecost. <S%G4005><s%>
And from Miletus <S%G3399><s%> he sent <S%G3992><s%> to Ephesus <S%G2181><s%> and called <S%G3333><s%> to him the elders <S%G4245><s%> of the church. <S%G1577><s%>

And when <S%G5613><s%> they had come <S%G3854><s%> to him, he said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You yourselves <S%G4771><s%> know, <S%G1987><s%> from the first <S%G4413><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> that I set <S%G1910><s%> foot <S%G1910><s%> in Asia, <S%G773><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> I was with you the whole <S%G3956><s%> time, <S%G5550><s%>

serving <S%G1398><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> with all <S%G3956><s%> humility <S%G5012><s%> and with tears <S%G1144><s%> and with trials <S%G3986><s%> which came <S%G4819><s%> upon me through <S%G1722><s%> the plots <S%G1917><s%> of the Jews; <S%G2453><s%>

how <S%G5613><s%> I did not shrink <S%G5288><s%> from declaring <S%G312><s%> to you anything <S%G3762><s%> that was profitable, <S%G4851><s%> and teaching <S%G1321><s%> you publicly <S%G1219><s%> and from house <S%G3624><s%> to house, <S%G3624><s%>

solemnly <S%G1263><s%> testifying <S%G1263><s%> to both <S%G5037><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> and Greeks <S%G1672><s%> of repentance <S%G3341><s%> toward <S%G1519><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> and faith <S%G4102><s%> in our Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ. <S%G5547><s%>

"And now, <S%G3568><s%> behold, <S%G2400><s%> bound <S%G1210><s%> in spirit, <S%G4151><s%> I am <S%G4198><s%> on my way <S%G4198><s%> to Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> not knowing <S%G3609><s%> what will happen <S%G4876><s%> to me there, <S%G1722><s%> <S%G846><s%>

except <S%G4133><s%> that the Holy <S%G40><s%> Spirit <S%G4151><s%> solemnly <S%G1263><s%> testifies <S%G1263><s%> to me in every <S%G2596><s%> city, <S%G4172><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> that bonds <S%G1199><s%> and afflictions <S%G2347><s%> await <S%G3306><s%> me.

"But I do not consider <S%G4160><s%> my life <S%G5590><s%> of any <S%G3762><s%> account <S%G3056><s%> as dear <S%G5093><s%> to myself, <S%G1683><s%> in order <S%G5613><s%> that I may finish <S%G5048><s%> my course, <S%G1408><s%> and the ministry <S%G1248><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> I received <S%G2983><s%> from the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> to testify <S%G1263><s%> solemnly <S%G1263><s%> of the gospel <S%G2098><s%> of the grace <S%G5485><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

"And now, <S%G3568><s%> behold, <S%G2400><s%> I know <S%G3609><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> of you, among <S%G1722><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I went <S%G1330><s%> about <S%G1330><s%> preaching <S%G2784><s%> the kingdom, <S%G932><s%> will see <S%G3708><s%> my face <S%G4383><s%> no <S%G3765><s%> more. <S%G3765><s%>

"Therefore <S%G1360><s%> I testify <S%G3143><s%> to you this <S%G4594><s%> day, <S%G2250><s%> that I am <S%G1510><s%> innocent <S%G2513><s%> of the blood <S%G129><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> men. <S%G3956><s%>
"For I did not shrink <S%G5288><s%> from declaring <S%G312><s%> to you the whole <S%G3956><s%> purpose <S%G1012><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

"Be on guard <S%G4337><s%> for yourselves <S%G1438><s%> and for all <S%G3956><s%> the flock, <S%G4168><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> the Holy <S%G40><s%> Spirit <S%G4151><s%> has made <S%G5087><s%> you overseers, <S%G1985><s%> to shepherd <S%G4165><s%> the church <S%G1577><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> He purchased <S%G4046><s%> with His own <S%G2398><s%> blood. <S%G129><s%>

"I know <S%G3609><s%> that after <S%G3326><s%> my departure <S%G867><s%> savage <S%G926><s%> wolves <S%G3074><s%> will come <S%G1525><s%> in among <S%G1519><s%> you, not sparing <S%G5339><s%> the flock; <S%G4168><s%>

and from among <S%G1537><s%> your own selves <S%G846><s%> men <S%G435><s%> will arise, <S%G450><s%> speaking <S%G2980><s%> perverse <S%G1294><s%> things, <S%G1294><s%> to draw <S%G645><s%> away <S%G645><s%> the disciples <S%G3101><s%> after <S%G3694><s%> them.

"Therefore <S%G1352><s%> be on the alert, <S%G1127><s%> remembering <S%G3421><s%> that night <S%G3571><s%> and day <S%G2250><s%> for a period <S%G5148><s%> of three <S%G5148><s%> years <S%G5148><s%> I did not cease <S%G3973><s%> to admonish <S%G3560><s%> each <S%G1538><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> with tears. <S%G1144><s%>

"And now <S%G3568><s%> I commend <S%G3908><s%> you to God <S%G2316><s%> and to the word <S%G3056><s%> of His grace, <S%G5485><s%> which is able <S%G1410><s%> to build <S%G3618><s%> [you] up and to give <S%G1325><s%> [you] the inheritance <S%G2817><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who are sanctified. <S%G37><s%>
"I have coveted <S%G1937><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> one's silver <S%G694><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> gold <S%G5553><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> clothes. <S%G2441><s%>
"You yourselves <S%G846><s%> know <S%G1097><s%> that these <S%G3778><s%> hands <S%G5495><s%> ministered <S%G5256><s%> to my [own] needs <S%G5532><s%> and to the men who were with me.

"In everything <S%G3956><s%> I showed <S%G5263><s%> you that by working <S%G2872><s%> hard <S%G2872><s%> in this <S%G3779><s%> manner <S%G3779><s%> you must <S%G1163><s%> help <S%G482><s%> the weak <S%G770><s%> and remember <S%G3421><s%> the words <S%G3056><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> that He Himself <S%G846><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'It is more <S%G3123><s%> blessed <S%G3107><s%> to give <S%G1325><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to receive. <S%G2983><s%>'"

And when he had said <S%G3004><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things, <S%G3778><s%> he knelt <S%G1119><s%> <S%G5087><s%> down <S%G5087><s%> <S%G1119><s%> and prayed <S%G4336><s%> with them all. <S%G3956><s%>
And they [began] to weep <S%G2805><s%> aloud <S%G2425><s%> and embraced <S%G1968><s%> <S%G1909><s%> <S%G5137><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and repeatedly kissed <S%G2705><s%> him,

grieving <S%G3600><s%> especially <S%G3122><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> he had spoken, <S%G3004><s%> that they should <S%G3195><s%> see <S%G2334><s%> his face <S%G4383><s%> no <S%G3765><s%> more. <S%G3765><s%> And they were accompanying <S%G4311><s%> him to the ship. <S%G4143><s%>
